Urgent neuroimaging (MRI) is critical to differentiate between ischaemic infarction, haemorrhage, demyelination, and neoplasm, as CT is less sensitive for brainstem pathology. Vascular imaging is required to rule out dissection or aneurysm. Bloods are needed to assess stroke risk factors and exclude mimics.
